title: shap.TreeExplainer crashes with xgboost R binary when using background data
body:
Hi all,

I am trying to load an xgboost model trained in R, and calculate shap values. (reason being I developed an interactive dashboard for displaying shap values etc  which I'd also like to make available to colleagues that still use R)

When I don't supply background data this works fine. However I would like to display probabilities and not just log odds, so I need to supply background data. However this crashes the kernel. 


```
model = xgb.XGBClassifier()
model.load_model(str(Path.cwd() / 'xgboost_R.model')) # binary saved in R with xgboost::save

X = df.drop('target', axis=1 )
y = pd.Series(np.where(df.target=='pos', 1, 0))

model.predict_proba(X)[0] # this works so model correctly loaded

shap_explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(model) # this works fine
shap_explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(model, X, model_output="probability", 
                                    feature_dependence= "independent") # this crashes the kernel
shap_explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(model, X) # also crashes the kernel

# if I refit the model everything works again:
model.fit(X, y)
shap_explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(model) , X, model_output="probability", 
                                    feature_dependence= "independent") # works fine
```

Anyone know a solution to this?
